title: Waterfall

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of gouache, over traces of graphite, on cream laid paper, edge mounted on board.

medium_display: Gouache, over traces of graphite, on cream laid paper, edge mounted on board
publication_history:
The Art Quarterly, 27 (1964), p. 499.

Harold Joachim, French Drawings and Sketchbooks of the Eighteenth Century (Chicago, 1979), pp. 44-45, no. 2C8.

Martha Tedeschi and Kristi Dahm, Watercolors by Winslow Homer: The Color of Light, exh. cat. (Yale University Press and the Art Institute of Chicago, 2008), pp. 76 (ill.), 77.
exhibition_history:
London, Wildenstein & Co., "French Drawings from Clouet to Ingres," March 1934, cat. 46.

Minneapolis Institute of Art, "Watercolors by the Masters: Dürer to Cézanne," May 1-June 15, 1952, cat. 25.

New York, Wildenstein & Co., "Timeless Master Drawings," November-December 1955, cat. 86.

New York, Wildenstein & Co., "For the Connoisseur," September 24-October 31, 1956, cat. 36.

Santa Barbara Museum of Art, Calif., "Painted Papers: Watercolors from Dürer to the Present," March 15-April 15, 1962, cat. 62.

The Art Institute of Chicago, "The Helen Regenstein Collection of European Drawings," 1974, pp. 108-09, cat. 54 (ill.), cat. by Harold Joachim.

The Art Institute of Chicago, "Selected Works of 18th Century French Art in the Collections of The Art Institute of Chicago," January 24-March 28, 1976, p. 69, cat. 63 (ill.).

Paris, Musée du Louvre, "Dessins français de l’Art Institute de Chicago de Watteau à Picasso," October 15, 1976-January 17, 1977, n.p., cat. 22 (ill.).

Frankfurt am Main, Germany, Städtische Galerie im Städelschen Kunstinstitut, "Französische Zeichnungen aus dem Art Institute of Chicago," February 10-April 10, 1977, pp. 50-51, cat. 20 (ill.).

New York, Wildenstein & Co., "Romance and Reality," October 17-November 25, 1978.

The Art Institute of Chicago, "The Regenstein Collection of European Drawings," 1985-1986.

The Art Institute of Chicago, "Recent Acquisitions to the Regenstein Collection," February 20-April 28, 1995.
provenance_text: Marquis Le Franc de Pompignan, Château de Hordesse; sold, Hôtel Drouot, Paris, June 20, 1927, lot 3, to Marius Paulme (died 1928), Paris [published auction results].  Wildenstein and Company, by March 1934-at least 1955 [London 1934; New York 1955].  Mrs. Joseph Regenstein, Chicago, by 1962 [Santa Barbara 1962]; given to the Art Institute, 1964.
